walks.title: Northumberland Legends Walk
walks.description: Explore the supernatural tales of Northumberland's ancient castles and mysterious landscapes

waypoints.instruction: Start at Bamburgh Castle. Look for the grey stones of the ancient fortress.
Travel south to Penshaw Monument. Follow the winding path to the hilltop.

walks.title: Mystical Creatures of the Countryside
walks.description: Journey through ancient woodlands and boglands to discover tales of magical beings

waypoints.instruction: Begin at the ancient oak tree. Listen for whispers in the wind.
Follow the wooden boardwalk across the marshland. Watch for dancing lights.

walks.title: The Haunting Heart of London
walks.description: Uncover the dark folklore of central London, from ghostly apparitions to monstrous serpents, as you walk the ancient streets of the City.

startLocation.name: Old Bailey / Site of Newgate Prison

waypoints.instruction: Begin at Old Bailey, once the site of Newgate Prison. Imagine the Black Dog stalking the dark corridors of the past.
Walk east along Giltspur Street and Cock Lane. Listen for ghostly knocks—you're now in 'Scratching Fanny’s' territory.
Head east to St. Mary-le-Bow Church on Cheapside. Look down the crypt steps and imagine a serpent slithering below.
Continue along Bread Street. Stop near the corner where bakers once short-changed the Devil himself.
